metadata.title: CVE-2018-1083 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Zsh before version 5.4.2-test-1 is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in theshell autocomplete functionality. A local unprivileged user can create aspecially crafted directory path which leads to code execution in thecontext of the user who tries to use autocomplete to traverse the beforementioned path. If the user affected is privileged, this leads to privilegeescalation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1083` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zsh - 5.1.1-1ubuntu2.2
zsh-common - 5.1.1-1ubuntu2.2
zsh-static - 5.1.1-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zsh package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.1.1-1ubuntu2.2').
